result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ae] cases 22CF114 and 22CF129 called 09:44 AM Defendant Ryan J Griffin appeared by telephone in custody from Lea Co Correctional Facility. Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court orders that Count 2 [based on Criminal Complaint] be added to 22CF129 and case to be renumbered to CM

The Court requires $500 CASH Bond to cover both 22CF114 and 22CF129, with conditions:
--no contact with co-defendant outside the presence of counsel
